title: Smoking Meat for Preservation
brief: Create a smoking enclosure to preserve meat for days or weeks without refrigeration.
steps: Step 1: Create enclosure around fire using two ponchos snapped together or similar material.
Step 2: Build small fire focused on producing smoke, not heat.
Step 3: Use hardwood (not resinous wood) that is somewhat green or soaked if too dry.
Step 4: Cut meat into thin slices no more than 6 centimeters thick.
Step 5: Drape meat over framework ensuring pieces don't touch each other.
Step 6: Maintain smoke for 8+ hours for 1 week preservation, 48 hours for 2-4 week preservation.
Step 7: Properly smoked meat will look dark, curled, and brittle.
warnings: Never use resinous wood - it will ruin the meat.
Don't let fire get too hot - you want smoke, not cooking heat.
Keep close watch on fire to maintain consistent smoke.
Ensure meat pieces don't touch to allow proper air circulation.
